conclusion: A semicircular glass brick with radius R has a critical angle γ for total internal reflection.
Parallel rays strike the base at an angle π - γ relative to the horizontal plane.
The image shows a semicircular glass brick with light striking at an angle π - γ.
The angle of incidence on the curved surface is π - γ.
The tangent point on the curved surface has an angle π - γ to the horizontal.
Using π - γ, the relationship between arc length x and R is π - γ = x/R.
Express π - γ in terms of γ: π - γ = -γ.
Take the absolute value for width: Width = R · γ.
The width of the portion of the base through which light passes is R · γ.
